item.title: Kat (A Journey In Reading) add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The books that the world calls immoral are books that show the world its own shame." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kat (A Journey In Reading) add a quote by Agatha Christie
item.description: "One doesn't recognize the really important moments in one's life until it's too late." -- Agatha Christie

item.title: Kat (A Journey In Reading) add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kat (A Journey In Reading) add a quote by Ian McEwan
item.description: "A person is, among all else, a material thing, easily torn and not easily mended." -- Ian McEwan

item.title: Kat (A Journey In Reading) add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "Love is so short, forgetting is so long." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Kat (A Journey In Reading) add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description:
"Sonnet XVII
I do not love you as if you were salt-rose, or topaz, or the arrow of carnations the fire shoots off. I love you as certain dark things are to be loved, in secret, between the shadow and the soul.
I love you as the plant that never blooms but carries in itself the light of hidden flowers; thanks to your love a certain solid fragrance, risen from the earth, lives darkly in my body.
I love you without knowing how, or when, or from where. I love you straightforwardly, without complexities or pride; so I love you because I know no other way than this:
where I does not exist, nor you, so close that your hand on my chest is my hand, so close that your eyes close as I fall asleep. " -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Kat (A Journey In Reading) add a quote by Charles M. Schulz
item.description: "All you need is love. But a little chocolate now and then doesn't hurt." -- Charles M. Schulz

item.title: Kat (A Journey In Reading) add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "Resist much, obey little." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Kat (A Journey In Reading) add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Courage is what it takes to stand up and speak; courage is also what it takes to sit down and listen." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Kat (A Journey In Reading) add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "There are books . . . which rank in our life with parents and lovers and passionate experiences." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Kat (A Journey In Reading) add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Nothing is at last sacred but the integrity of your own mind." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Kat (A Journey In Reading) add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Women are meant to be loved, not to be understood." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kat (A Journey In Reading) add a quote by Joyce Carol Oates
item.description: "Reading is the sole means by which we slip, involuntarily, often helplessly, into another's skin, another's voice, another's soul." -- Joyce Carol Oates

item.title: Kat (A Journey In Reading) add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "I learned this, at least, by my experiment: that if one advances confidently in the direction of his dreams, and endeavors to live the life which he has imagined, he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Kat (A Journey In Reading) add a quote by Ann Brashares
item.description: "What can I say? I'm obsessed. And as we all know obsessed girls can't be held responsible for our actions." -- Ann Brashares

item.title: Kat (A Journey In Reading) add a quote by Sara Nelson
item.description: "Explaining the moment of connection between a reader and book to someone who's never experienced it is like trying to describe sex to a virgin." -- Sara Nelson

item.title: Kat (A Journey In Reading) add a quote by Sara Nelson
item.description: "When things go right, I read. When things go wrong, I read more." -- Sara Nelson

item.title: Kat (A Journey In Reading) add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "This is not a novel to be tossed aside lightly. It should be thrown with great force." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Kat (A Journey In Reading) add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Kat (A Journey In Reading) add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "A person's a person, no matter how small." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Kat (A Journey In Reading) add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Have you ever been in love? Horrible isn't it? It makes you so vulnerable. It opens your chest and it opens up your heart and it means that someone can get inside you and mess you up." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Kat (A Journey In Reading) add a quote by Ian McEwan
item.description: "This is how the entire course of a life can be changed: by doing nothing." -- Ian McEwan

item.title: Kat (A Journey In Reading) add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "No book is really worth reading at the age of ten which is not equally – and often far more – worth reading at the age of fifty and beyond." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Kat (A Journey In Reading) add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Never trust anyone who has not brought a book with them." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Kat (A Journey In Reading) add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "Education is the ability to listen to almost anything without losing your temper or your self-confidence." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Kat (A Journey In Reading) add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "Love is an irresistible desire to be irresistibly desired." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Kat (A Journey In Reading) add a quote by Andre Gide
item.description: "Believe those who are seeking the truth. Doubt those who find it." -- Andre Gide

item.title: Kat (A Journey In Reading) add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Finish each day and be done with it. You have done what you could. Some blunders and absurdities no doubt crept in; forget them as soon as you can. Tomorrow is a new day. You shall begin it serenely and with too high a spirit to be encumbered with your old nonsense." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Kat (A Journey In Reading) add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "We accept the love we think we deserve." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Kat (A Journey In Reading) add a quote by Lily Tomlin
item.description: "The trouble with being in the rat race is that even if you win, you're still a rat." -- Lily Tomlin
